videos.title: Little Apple Gravel Race 100k Open 2025 - Manhattan Illinois
videos.description:
Join me on the rugged, dusty gravel roads just 50 miles southwest of Chicago for the thrilling Little Apple Gravel Race, a fast-growing event that's capturing the hearts of cyclists!  This year’s race offered something for everyone, with USAC-licensed categories (50km and 100km) and the popular Open categories (50km, 100km, and 150km). 
In this video, I tackle the challenging 100km (63-mile) Open category, battling tough terrain and epic competition. Watch the action, feel the grind, and discover why this gravel race is a must for cycling enthusiasts! Don’t forget to like, comment, and subscribe for more biking adventures!  

00:00 - Intro
03:05 - Bridge/Start
11:09 - Close The Gap
16:01 - The Lead Group
22:30 - The Farm
29:44 - Getting Dropped
36:03 - The Sprint

videos.title: Little Apple Gravel Race | Manhattan IL
videos.description:
The first Illinois State Championship Gravel Race!

My first Gran Fondo gravel bike race! 61 miles of rough gravel and some smaller roads and you guessed it, lots of corn! Location - Manhattan Illinois (40 mins from Chicago).

This gravel race is hosted by South Chicago Wheelman.

videos.title: 2019.08.11 Little Apple 100k
videos.description:
This is a gravel race in Manhattan Illinois, beautifully organized by the South Chicago Wheelmen. The race is 2 laps of a 50k course thru farm roads, with a small bit of pavement, mostly 'normal' gravel, and one or two sections of 'pretty loose'. My tires were 40mm G-One Speed at probably like 50 PSI. I'd do the same thing next time - this race isn't one I could ride 28mm. It rained just before the race, but the sun came out as we started. Steady wind from the South.

Video starts as we roll thru the finish line with 50k done and 50k to go. The group is reduced to about 30 here. 

56:06 - Starts to get selective. Tailwind section here.
57:35 - Crosswind left-to-right. Group can smell the finish, it's time to go hard.
59:52 - This is such a good spot to rest up for a moment. Riders in the left lane are shelter from the wind, plus rider in front.
1:02:15 - This is pretty much the group that made it to the finish together.
1:07:33 - Left turn onto probably the loosest section here. You can see that my soft-over-hard skills are totally absent here. Wind is right to left, once we make the turn. Don't worry, I'm still getting quite a bit of shelter even one lane over :)
1:27:03 - This is where you see Sean's race-winning sprint
